title: Demand shocks and the Phillips curve

content.question:
Use the graph below of the long-run Philips Curve <math alttext="open parenthesis, L R P C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>LRPC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and the short-run Phillips Curve <math alttext="open parenthesis, S R P C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>SRPC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> to answer the question.

Assume the economy is in long-run equilibrium. A decrease in net exports will result in which of the following in the short run?

choices.label: The <math alttext="S R P C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>SRPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will shift to the left.
The <math alttext="S R P C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>SRPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will shift to the right.
The <math alttext="L R P C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will shift to the right.
There will be a movement from point B to point C.
There will be a movement from point B to point A.

content.answer: There will be a movement from point B to point C.
